name: Kitchenette
homepage_content: Modern Kitchenettes For Small Spaces | Kitchenette NZ by Plumbob ‚Äì Kitchenette By Plumbob Skip to content Search Reset Search Load slide 1 of 4 Load slide 2 of 4 Load slide 3 of 4 Load slide 4 of 4 Pause slideshow Play slideshow Floating Kitchenette redefines space A bold new direction in compact kitchen design has launched. Discover The Floating range, a customisable pre-wired and pre-plumbed kitchenette with optional appliances that can be installed in just one hour. explore floating range Kitchenettes are created with simplicity at their core, using locally sourced products and materials in New Zealand The complete package is specified with quality Panasonic and Robinhood appliances, pre-wired and pre-plumbed. The finished product will be fully or mostly assembled in our East Tamaki factory and delivered to your door, saving you time and money. Simple. No two spaces are the same, so your choices are many and varied. Kitchenettes allow you to change configurations, add a pantry, a washer/dryer combo, a large fridge or extra storage. Even the splashbacks have a wide range of colour options. Specify to your requirements. Simple. Your alternative? A flat pack kitchenette. Not simple. View Kitchenettes Explore the kitchenette range Compact Wall Units Regular Wall Units Extended Wall Units Compact Counter Units Regular Counter Units Extended Counter Units Load slide 1 of 3 Load slide 2 of 3 Load slide 3 of 3 Pause slideshow Play slideshow DESIGNS AND MODELS TO FIT ANY SMALL SPACE Our modern kitchenettes can be supplied as counter- or wall-mounted models. The wall-mounted models have additional storage above the benchtop and can include a rangehood and microwave. Each size offers a variety of models with preconfigured appliance combinations. Simply select a model that best fits your space and has the necessary appliances and functionality. IDEAL FOR: Garages, sheds and cabins Rumpus rooms and man caves Granny flats and sleep outs Shipping containers Tiny homes and dwellings Retail stores and small business kitchens Hotels, motels and apartments Social housing and aged care facilities ‚úî Top Quality Appliances Our kitchenettes use locally sourced Panasonic and Robinhood appliances, which come with standard manufacturer warranties. Cooktops, range hoods, fridges, dishwashers, ovens, microwaves, and trim kits are pre-installed to ensure a perfect fit. To prevent potential freight damage, some appliances are repackaged for transportation. The all-in-one kitchenette concept provides exceptional value for money. ‚úî Fast installation Compact and Regular kitchenettes can be set up in just 60 minutes, including the supplied appliances and necessary electrical and plumbing components, saving you time and money. Electrical and plumbing connections require registered tradespeople. Certificates of Compliance (COCs) are essential for warranties to be valid. ‚úî Simple electrical connection Our unique power board is a standard kitchenette feature. A single junction box and wiring loom feed the pre-fitted double power outlets, ready for your electrician to terminate on-site. Components are locally sourced and come with an electrical declaration of conformity. All models have two power outlets above the bench for your kettle, toaster or coffee machine. ‚úî Simple plumbing setup The sink, waste basket, and sink overflow are installed on the benchtop. The mixer tap, waste pipe, and P-trap are pre-fitted and then removed for transport. If your kitchenette includes a dishwasher, the P-trap will have the proper discharge connection. Our dishwashers come equipped with an aqua-stop inlet hose. A registered plumber must complete all water and wastewater connections. ‚úî Fully or mostly assembled Depending on the size of your kitchenette and access to your property, we can deliver it fully assembled. Larger units arrive mostly assembled. We'll provide the necessary assembly instructions, hardware, and specialised connector tools. With on-site services in place and tradies on hand, you could be cooking in just 60 minutes. ‚úî Nationwide delivery We have extensive experience shipping kitchenettes and glass display cases throughout the country. Our trusted providers will deliver your kitchenette to its final location anywhere in New Zealand. Need something more Custom? We can help you to design a kitchenette that perfectly fits your style and space. Contact our design team to get started today. Contact us New Zealand Made Our kitchen cabinets are proudly designed and manufactured in New Zealand with quality materials, components and appliances. Sustainable Materials We develop all our products with sustainability in mind, using materials sourced from certified Environmental Choice suppliers across New Zealand. Certified Environmental Choice Our certified environmental choice suppliers include: Bestwood, Prime Panels, Daiken, Southland Ltd and New Zealand Panels Ltd. what our clients say ‚òÖ‚òÖ‚òÖ‚òÖ‚òÖ I recently had the pleasure of purchasing a ready-made kitchenette from Kitchenette by Plumbob, and I am absolutely thrilled with the result! After spending considerable time comparing pricing for flat-packed units from Mitre 10 and Bunnings, I decided to go with a pre-assembled, professionally installed unit, and it was definitely the right choice. The quality of the unit is outstanding‚Äîevery detail is meticulously crafted, and the fittings are top-notch. The delivery was prompt, arriving exactly when expected, and the installation was smooth and hassle-free. The customer service throughout the process was exceptional, with the team keeping me informed every step of the way and addressing any questions I had. I couldn‚Äôt be more pleased with my decision to invest in this unit, and I highly recommend it to anyone seeking a high-quality, well-made kitchenette. Michelle Brown | Director | REEL Direct Limited ‚òÖ‚òÖ‚òÖ‚òÖ‚òÖ We have received and installed several Kitchenettes to date for our Aged Care Facilities in the far North. Kitchenette‚Äôs save time, being delivered mostly assembled. The inclusion of appliances and pre-fitted electrical and plumbing components make life easy. My team had the kitchenettes fully assembled and in position within an hour due to pre-assembly, electrical pre-fitting and plumbing. I can fully recommend Kitchenette throughout the entire process. Paul Newman | Far North District Council ‚òÖ‚òÖ‚òÖ‚òÖ‚òÖ I needed a small kitchen area for a hair salon. The size was exactly what we needed. Manufactured and delivered in a timely fashion. I love the fact that everything was included... microwave, fridge, power points and sink with tap and plumbing/electrical all included. Highly recommend. name: Kapiti Sushi
homepage_content: KƒÅpiti Midwives - Find a Midwife | Midwifery Services KƒÅpiti Coast Skip to content Loading... Midwifery on the KƒÅpiti Coast MEET THE MIDWIVES Midwifery on the Kapiti Coast MEET THE MIDWIVES Home whitedogdm 2023-09-28T23:47:40+00:00 Full midwifery care from ≈åtaki to Pukerua Bay KƒÅpiti Midwives offer specialist midwifery care for you and your baby/pƒìpi throughout pregnancy and up to six weeks following your birth. Our midwifery practice is based upon continuity of care, the empowerment of women, the provision of safe effective care and the application of knowledge, experience, and evidence-based research. We believe that pregnancy and childbirth are normal life events for most wƒÅhine. Together our team of friendly midwives support wƒÅhine to give birth at home, Paraparaumu Maternity Unit or Wellington Hospital, and often incorporate cultural, spiritual and complementary practices. If you choose to birth at home, a second KƒÅpiti midwife will also attend your birth. KƒÅpiti Midwives are all Registered with the Midwifery Council of New Zealand and are members of the New Zealand College of Midwives whose standards of practice and regular review processes guide the care we provide. We‚Äôd love to meet you! Come and meet us on the first Wednesday of each month from 10am-11am upstairs in the Wild Wellbeing Studio at 345 KƒÅpiti Road for a completely no obligation chat. Here we can get to know each other and answer any questions you may have over a cup of coffee. You‚Äôre more than welcome to bring someone with you. MEET US FOR COFFEE Our philosophy KƒÅpiti Midwives has provided midwifery care to women on the KƒÅpiti Coast since 1992. Our group of dedicated midwives all share the same philosophy surrounding pregnancy, labour and birth. We believe that pregnancy, labour and childbirth are normal life events for most wƒÅhine. Working together a midwife, woman and whƒÅnau shape the midwifery care, often incorporating cultural, spiritual and complementary practices. We encourage mutual sharing of information and decision-making in order to develop a trusting relationship which will contribute to a positive pregnancy and birth experience. HOW OUR PRACTICE WORKS Join KƒÅpiti Midwives on Facebook Keep up to date with everything that‚Äôs happening at KƒÅpiti Midwives, including on-call midwife schedules, up-coming classes, events, tips, advice and more! name: Simply Indian
homepage_content: Simply Indian, delicious Indian food in Motueka BOOKINGS & TAKEAWAYS: 03 528 6364 TAKEAWAY MENU ORDER ONLINE - CLICK & COLLECT Simply Indian Restaurant & Take-away, Motueka Motueka's Indian Restaurant NAMASTE! And welcome to Simply Indian Simply Indian has been serving fine Indian cuisine for over twenty years to Motueka's locals and many visitors. Mouth-watering authentic Indian dishes, prepared by trained and experienced Indian chefs, for you to relish and enjoy. Not forgetting an ice cold Kingfisher to get your meal off to a good start. Our bar has a good selection of wines and soft drinks too. So after a hard days work or a trip into the Abel Tasman come and see Sabin and all the staff - they look forward to welcoming you. Simply Indian, the original Motueka Indian restaurant We're now over 20 years old. "I started work here 10 years ago in front of house as duty manager, and commuted from Nelson every day. I loved coming to work in Motueka and chatting with all the regulars and tourist visitors from far and wide. One day the opportunity to buy the restaurant came up and I jumped at the idea. I liked Motueka, the restaurant and its beautiful clientele so much that I bought it. And so I became the very proud owner of Simply Indian. I had just started a family and we moved to Motueka straight-away to be closer to our new venture. Two of the chefs from those days are the main stay of our kitchen still, ensuring you receive consistent quality dining every time you visit us. You might find cheaper but I'm confident you won't find better quality and taste. Thanks to everyone who dines with us, you have kept us going through the ups and downs that life throws our way." Sabin Lunch: 11am-2pm (5 days, Mon-Sat, closed Tuesday lunchtime) Dinner: from 5pm till late (7 days) Fully licensed & BYO - corkage fee: - $10 Great choice of vegetarian and vegan dishes Banquets & parties, dinner for two, a group of friends or a Friday shout with your work mates. It's best at Simply Indian in Motueka. Dining in? We recommend booking to avoid disappointment. NO surcharge on public holidays. CCTV is used on our premises to keep our staff and customers safe. Find Us Phone: 03 528 6364 Website By WeDoWebsites

name: Ohaeawai Hotel
homepage_content: The Ohaeawai Hotel | Northland backpacker and budget holiday accommodation in Bay of Islands and close to Kaikohe and the Twin Coast Cycle Trail in the far north of New Zealand nz Welcome Accommodation Out and About Food and Drink Gateway to the Cycle Trail Getting Here Contacting Us Comfortable accommodation and meals in a Heritage Hotel. Free, unlimited Wi-Fi. Experience traditional New Zealand Hospitality at is finest. Steeped in history, Ohaeawai (historically called Taiamai) is situated at the junction of State Highways 1 & 12, on what is locally known as 'The Crossroads'. Just as in times past, this apparently sleepy Village is still a major stop for locals and visitors alike. Ohaeawai is very convenient to the Twin Coast Cycle Trail from Bay of Islands to the Hokianga. The 13km first stage of the cycleway from nearby Kaikohe to Okaihau opened in 2011. Still a dominant feature of the area today, the historic Ohaeawai Hotel is a favourite gathering place for locals, residents from nearby settlements and visitors alike. You will often find the friendly, well known characters of the area engaged in a good old fashioned chin wag, a game of pool , or maybe just contemplating the day. The Ohaeawai Community has a keen interest in sporting competition, fielding championship winning men's rugby. There are also 18 hole and 9 hole golf courses very close by, so it's not surprising that many Ohaeawai folk enjoy this pastime. Whether you're passing through or staying a while longer, Ohaeawai is interesting in the present day as well as in its history. Centrally situated on the intersection of State Highway One and Twelve, the√Ç township of Ohaeawai makes an excellent base for exploring the Bay of Islands, Kerikeri, Pahia, Russell, Hokianga Harbour, Kaitaia, Whangarei and Cape Reinga. CAMPERVANS VERY WELCOME, and if you join us for a meal and drinks your Van can stay for FREE!!!! (some conditions apply) ¬© 2007 - Ohaeawai Hotel. All rights reserved | site by Redan Online

Steeped in history, Ohaeawai (historically called Taiamai) is situated at the junction of State Highways 1 & 12, on what is locally known as 'The Crossroads'. Just as in times past, this apparently sleepy Village is still a major stop for locals and visitors alike. Ohaeawai is very convenient to the Twin Coast Cycle Trail from Bay of Islands to the Hokianga. The 13km first stage of the cycleway from nearby Kaikohe to Okaihau opened in 2011. Still a dominant feature of the area today, the historic Ohaeawai Hotel is a favourite gathering place for locals, residents from nearby settlements and visitors alike. You will often find the friendly, well known characters of the area engaged in a good old fashioned chin wag, a game of pool , or maybe just contemplating the day. The Ohaeawai Community has a keen interest in sporting competition, fielding championship winning men's rugby. There are also 18 hole and 9 hole golf courses very close by, so it's not surprising that many Ohaeawai folk enjoy this pastime. Whether you're passing through or staying a while longer, Ohaeawai is interesting in the present day as well as in its history. Centrally situated on the intersection of State Highway One and Twelve, the√Ç township of Ohaeawai makes an excellent base for exploring the Bay of Islands, Kerikeri, Pahia, Russell, Hokianga Harbour, Kaitaia, Whangarei and Cape Reinga. CAMPERVANS VERY WELCOME, and if you join us for a meal and drinks your Van can stay for FREE!!!! (some conditions apply) ¬© 2007 - Ohaeawai Hotel. All rights reserved | site by Redan Online

name: Chic-A-Dee Canterbury
homepage_content: Prima Deli | Fresh. Ready to Eat. top of page HEALTHY MADE EASY At Prima Deli, we believe that amazing lunches start with amazing ingredients. That‚Äôs why we place such a strong emphasis on freshness, quality, and balance in everything we make. From freshly baked breads and premium meats and cheeses to crisp seasonal produce, every item is carefully chosen to create meals that are as nourishing as they are delicious. Our range is designed to suit a wide variety of tastes and occasions. Choose from classic sandwiches, hearty subs, wholesome wraps, flavour-packed sushi, and convenient ‚Äúheat to eat‚Äù options ‚Äî all crafted to deliver maximum flavour with minimum fuss. Whether you‚Äôre after something light and refreshing, or filling and satisfying, ‚Äã We‚Äôre proud to offer food that combines the wholesome goodness Kiwis love with the convenience today‚Äôs busy lifestyles demand ‚Äî without ever compromising on freshness or taste. 100% FRESH You can enjoy Prima Deli products at service stations, supermarkets, airlines, and selected caf√©s right across New Zealand ‚Äî making it easy to grab something fresh and satisfying wherever your day takes you. From quick on-the-go lunches to light bites while you travel, our ready-to-eat range is designed to fit seamlessly into busy Kiwi lifestyles. If you‚Äôre interested in stocking Prima Deli, we‚Äôd love to work with you. We offer flexible delivery options, competitive pricing, and a wide product range tailored to suit different markets and customer preferences. Our team can provide product information, order forms, and support to make the process simple and efficient. TALK WITH US CATERING Let Prima Deli take the stress out of catering your next school/sports/community event, lunch, meeting, event, or celebration. Our team can provide packaged products or prepare beautifully presented platters and trays featuring our signature fresh sandwiches, sushi, wraps, and other ready-to-enjoy options from our catering menu. Whether you‚Äôre hosting events, colleagues, friends, or family, we‚Äôll make sure the food is as memorable as the occasion. Because we focus on quality and freshness, all catering orders are prepared to order. A minimum of three weekdays‚Äô notice helps us ensure your food is made with the finest ingredients and delivered at its freshest. OUR STORY At Prima Deli, food is family. Since 2000, we‚Äôve been committed to bringing New Zealanders ready-to-eat convenience meals that combine freshness you can trust with quality you can rely on every day. Prima Deli began with a simple idea: to fill the gap in the market for deli-style, ready-to-eat sandwiches and wholesome foods that taste as good as they look. Built on the back of our very popular Chic-A-Dee brand, from day one Prima Deli has been focused on honest freshness, wholesome goodness, exceptional flavour, and guaranteed food safety ‚Äî values that continue to guide everything we do. All of our products are crafted from our purpose-built facilities in Christchurch and Auckland servicing South and North Islands with prime natural ingredients, responsible packaging, stringent quality controls, and high service levels. We believe good food should be effortless, so we design our range to suit the broad Kiwi palate while meeting today‚Äôs demand for convenience, safety, quality and price. Behind the scenes, we continually invest in modern equipment and technology, and innovative processes to ensure every item we make is consistent, safe, and fresh. From seasonal menu updates to swift market response, our team works hard to stay ahead while never compromising on taste. Our dedicated team is the secret ingredient in every product we make, for you to enjoy. Over two decades later, Prima Deli has grown into a benchmark name in New Zealand‚Äôs ready-to-eat market, trusted by consumers across the country. And as we like to say ‚Äî the proof is in the eating. bottom of page

name: Ramen Ria
homepage_content: Japanese Ramen Bar | Ramen Ria | New Zealand top of page ABOUT US Ramen Ria is an absolute stalwart of the ramen scene in Christchurch, serving up soul warming bowls of ramen as well as other popular Japanese street eats - Edamame, Takoyaki, Karrage Chicken and Donburi. We take great pride in crafting authentic, tasty dishes using locally sourced fresh ingredients, noodles are made fresh on the daily, while bone broths are brewed for 8+ hours to give them a rich flavour. On top of that, the upstair bar provides you heaps of options of Japanese beer, soju and cocktails. Cool vibes only. READ MORE loading, walk in also welcome anytime :) WHAT PEOPLE SAY ABOUT US "No exaggeration - best ramen I have ever had. Ask about the $20 special, ramen & a side of fried chicken. Highly recommend the pork trio ramen! Staff are super friendly and the wait time is minimal (15 mins for us). I would post a photo of the food as soon as it came out but I was so hungry that I forgot to take one! Here's a photo of a half finished ramen, but trust me when I say that it's fantastic." Matt from Google Review Inquire private function & venue hire here Book bottom of page

name: Retropolitan Social
homepage_content: Retropolitan: Bar & Dining. Sport & Live Music. Functions & Events Retro Socailising for Retro Live Music for Retro Dining for Retro Sport for Retro Cocktails for Retropolitan Social is a retro central Christchurch bar, restaurant and functions venue. Come and enjoy our friendly and relaxed atmosphere. We have live music at the weekends and sport playing on our two projectors; one inside, and one on our all-weather deck with 7 massive gas heaters and an open fire. Come up and see us and enjoy a classic fondue, 1/2 metre pizza or 1/2 metre platter from our new fantastic menu plus 12 great beers on tap, and our Bar Manager mixing old school cocktails. We specialise in social and corporate functions and events and we are damned good at it. We're located in the Salt District, upstairs beside Little High. Pop on up and say high. We'd love to see you, and we're sure you'll love our atmosphere, character and retro service. Opening Hours Monday ‚Äì Closed Tuesday to Friday: 3pm ‚Äì Late Saturday: 3pm ‚Äì Late Sunday: 3 pm ‚Äì Late Book Now Sky Sport We will be playing all the major sporting events. Come in and enjoy a drink and a bite in front of one of our 2 projectors. 12 Tap Beers We have a range of beers and ciders on tap, from lovely hoppy craft IPAs, to your old retro favourites. New Menu Check out our new extensive menu. Whether you're after Sunday brunch, a date-night meal, or delicious bar snacks, we've got you covered. Live Music There is nothing better than a bit of live music, and at Retro we've got a mix of soulful duos, pumping bands and funky DJs on rotation to keep you entertained Retro Cocktails Come up and see our very own bar manager and mixologist Callum. Try a Harvey Wallbanger, Old Fashioned or a Belgian Biscuit. Private Functions We have several options available for your next function, whether you require part or all of the venue. Get in touch for details.

name: Smithfield Berries
homepage_content: Smithfield Raspberries 0 Our farm shop is now CLOSED for the season! Raspberries are our main passion. Not only are they ridiculously delicious but also jam packed full of cancer fighting antioxidants. Our varieties include the Waiau and Selwyn raspberries. These have been specifically chosen for being large, juicy and oh so sweet. Our Berries Buy Fresh fruit or pick them yourself! Contact Us Did you know raspberries are one of the top 2 fruits for health benefits? Read More Looking for cooking inspiration? Recipes Guidelines for keeping berries tasting fresher for longer. Read More FAQs When does your season start? Our season generally runs from the start of December through to the end of January. What are your shop open hours? During our season (December-January), our shop is open 8am - 5.30pm 7 days a week. Outside of our season, frozen fruit sales are by appointment only. What fruit do you have for sale? We grow Raspberries, Blackberries and Ranui. We also have Pick Your Own (P.Y.O) raspberries. We DO NOT offer P.Y.O Blackberries or Ranui Can we bring our children? Yes, absolutely! All we ask is that your children are under supervision at all times - we are a working farm with many hazards! Do you have eftpos? Yes - we accept cash or eftpos payments. However, we do not accept paywave or credit cards!! How do we get there? 90 Smithfield Road, R.D. 2, Ashburton, New Zealand

name: Hokitika Townchip
homepage_content: Hokitika Townchip 0 SKIP THE QUEUE ORDER ONLINE THE LOCAL TOWN CHIPPERY A KICK ASS ARRAY OF FAST FOOD KAI ORDER ONLINE and we‚Äôll text you when your order is ready - easy as! Want to score a free scoop? Join our Frequent Fryer Loyalty Club today SIGN UP TRY SOMTHING FISHY Rig Where the term ‚Äòshark ‚Äòn‚Äô taties‚Äô comes from. Rig belongs to the Triakidae family - a group of houndsharks / ground sharks. They‚Äòre Jaw‚Äôs little cousin - so while you won‚Äòt need a bigger boat, you‚Äôre deffo gonna need a bigger stomach. A prized fish & chip shop fav it is a firm, white, boneless fish with low oil content. Freshly fried Rig can initiate a feeding frenzy. Elephant A fish & chip superstar. Elephant Fish have firm white flesh with low oil content - they belong to the same group as sharks and rays so there are no bones, only cartilage. Despite the kind expression in their eyes, they won‚Äôt be coming to a Disney movie near you, specifically because of their very disturbing nose thingy. Luckily they taste better than they look! Blue Cod Blue Cod are indigenous to New Zealand and are common in colder waters South of the Cook Strait and around the Chatham Islands. The Codfather of the fish and chip world... Highly prized for its mild, slightly sweet taste. It is best enjoyed battered and washed down with a nice tipple. AND Blue Cod being bottom dwellers it‚Äôs more than fitting to say... ‚ÄúBottom‚Äôs Up!‚Äù ORDER NOW ‚ÄúThe Townchip is the best! Great burgers, and funny fishreviews on the wallpaper. So good!‚Äù ‚Äì Caz, Frequent Fryer Read More Reviews

name: Urban Oyster Bar & Eatery
homepage_content: Nelson Restaurant and Bar - Urban Eatery Welcome to Urban Eatery Restaurant and Bar in Nelson! Don‚Äôt be afraid to put your elbows on the table and engage us and your fellow diners. Get to know us and what‚Äôs inspiring us today. We‚Äôll be delivering the food we‚Äôre currently passionate about on each plate we serve, sourced from local suppliers. We hope you come with a curious spirit! RESERVATIONS Bookings are available for lunch and dinner for dining purposes only. Don't worry however, we'll be keeping some tables free for those of you who like to fly by the seat of your pants and have some drinks and nibbles! BOOK NOW MENU Our menu changes regularly with respect to what we are into at the moment, whether it‚Äôs an ingredient, band, chef or current event. Our goal is to make everyone feel like whanau (family) ‚Äì whether it is your first or fortieth time. We believe that serving up good juju in a restaurant isn‚Äôt just in the food and drink, but in the attitude and atmosphere which will make Urban the perfect place to stop in and refuel. VIEW MENU OYSTERS ROCK!! We‚Äôre truly lucky to be surrounded by amazing food producers who help make us look good. Thanks to Te Matuku, Te Kouma and Marlborough for our amazing oysters, waiting to be freshly shucked for you to enjoy and served in our Oyster Bar ... don't like oysters?? All good we've got you covered, heaps of other yummy dishes to choose from! SUP FROM THE BAR Aside from great craft beer and a modest but outstanding wine list, we think we do a pretty mean cocktail. Somewhere in the world it‚Äôs cocktail hour. BOOKINGS You are now able to book for both lunch and dinner, with reservations available for groups of up to 10 diners. GIFT VOUCHERS Gift vouchers are available online, instantly! If you would prefer a physical voucher (instead of a digital one) pop in and see us at 274 Hardy Street and the team will be happy to help out! TREAT SOMEONE!

name: Aroma India
homepage_content: Aroma India Greytown Restaurant & Takeaway Welcome To Aroma India Greytown Open 6 Days from Tuesday to Sunday ORDER ONLINE BOOK TABLE Welcome To Aroma India Greytown Best place for Family and Friends ORDER ONLINE BOOK TABLE Welcome To Aroma India Greytown Pop in to see the restaurant in action and pick-up your orders ORDER ONLINE BOOK TABLE THE BEST TRADITIONAL INDIAN RESTAURANT Pick Up Delivery Table Booking AROMA OUR DELICIOUS FOOD AT YOUR HOME Check our Menu Who We Are About Us My wife and I have worked in the hospitality industry for many years. We opened in Greytown in 2015 and focused on providing a friendly, welcoming atmosphere in which our diners can enjoy our fabulous food served by our knowledgeable staff. We then opened Aroma India Silverstream in January 2018 and Aroma India Martinborough in July 2021. Our Food We serve innovative, fresh meals cooked to order which is why you sometimes have to wait for your meals to be ready. We mix our own spices in-house rather than using ready-mixed packets to help contribute to the freshness of our food. We also make our own paneer in-house as you will be able to tell from the √¢¬Ä¬úsqueaks√¢¬Ä¬ù it makes when you eat it. All of these factors contribute to the √¢¬Ä¬úAroma India flavour√¢¬Ä¬ù. Private Function Over the years, we have seen many celebrations and we are happy to cater to large groups and allow the restaurant to be decorated within reason. If you are bringing young children that need to be given something to eat quickly, please us know and we will do our best to help you to get them settled so that you can all enjoy your evening. ORDER ONLINE NOW Customer Reviews Listen to what our customers say about us Karen √¢¬Ä¬úWe LOVE Aroma India. The food is always fabulous and the service friendly. The restaurant has a nice modern feel to it and does not feel crowded even when full. We are never hurried when we are there and feel that we can take our time eating. Although I√¢¬Ä¬ôm not a vegetarian, some of my favourite dishes are the paneer, the mushrooms and the dal makhani. I also love the Hariayala Murgh. The portions are a good size, particularly the biryanis. The chefs are very approachable and happy to show-off the kitchen.√¢¬Ä¬ù Rob √¢¬Ä¬ú√¢¬Ä¬úComing from the UK and being local in Greytown, we were very excited about a new Indian Restaurant in our town. When we tried it and found it to be consistently the best curry in New Zealand, we were blown away. We can definitely recommend our favourite dishes which are Hariayala Murgh and Malabari Fish.√¢¬Ä¬ù Chris √¢¬Ä¬úWith the arrival of √¢¬Ä¬úAroma√¢¬Ä¬ù, Greytown can now boast as having the best Indian Restaurant in the Lower North Island. The ambience and style is warm and inviting, the staff always attentive friendly and happy. The menu is wide and varied but must-try dishes are the Garlic Chicken Tikka, the Hariayala Murgh, Lamb Masala and the Chicken Korma. After several visits, it√¢¬Ä¬ôs always a great feeling that the staff recognise you and always make you feel special. Dining-in or taking-out, nothing is an issue, and home delivery is always a massive bonus on cold winter nights!! √¢¬Ä¬ú Maureen √¢¬Ä¬úOne of the best Indian restaurants in the Wellington region. My husband and I go there several times a month for lunch or dinner as the menu is extensive, authentic, and the staff is exceedingly friendly and attentive. Dishes can be made to-order and Aroma has one of the best combination of spices, sauces, and fresh ingredients. An added bonus, we have taken our young Grandchildren there on occasion and they too are made to feel equally welcome. I highly recommend Aroma for anyone wanting a great Indian meal!√¢¬Ä¬ù Colin √¢¬Ä¬úBefore dining at aroma india I√¢¬Ä¬ôd had Indian food half-a-dozen times but found its a little dry and not to my taste. We moved to Greytown 2 years ago and my wife asked me to try Aroma India. I found the restaurant to be clean and inviting, and the owner and staff pleasant and eager to chat. I now love Indian food √¢¬Ä¬ì it√¢¬Ä¬ôs always fresh and very tasty. My favourite is their chicken khorma (medium) with their delicious garlic naan. We like to eat there once a week. The first time we went there we asked for ice in our wine √¢¬Ä¬ì strange but true! The second time they remembered us and asked if we would like ice! AMAZING! GREAT STAFF, GREAT FOOD.√¢¬Ä¬ù Chelle √¢¬Ä¬úAroma has added some delicious spice to our life! We love trying something new each visit and appreciate being able to specify the level of spice. The hariyala murgh is delicious.√¢¬Ä¬ù Previous Next LOCATION 74-76 Main Street, Greytown 5712, New Zealand 06 304 8080 069298209 aromaindia38@gmail.com Phone 06 304 8080, 069298209 Email aromaindia03@gmail.com Location 74-76 Main Street, Greytown 5712 ‚Üë

If you are bringing young children that need to be given something to eat quickly, please us know and we will do our best to help you to get them settled so that you can all enjoy your evening. ORDER ONLINE NOW Customer Reviews Listen to what our customers say about us Karen √¢¬Ä¬úWe LOVE Aroma India. The food is always fabulous and the service friendly. The restaurant has a nice modern feel to it and does not feel crowded even when full. We are never hurried when we are there and feel that we can take our time eating. Although I√¢¬Ä¬ôm not a vegetarian, some of my favourite dishes are the paneer, the mushrooms and the dal makhani. I also love the Hariayala Murgh. The portions are a good size, particularly the biryanis. The chefs are very approachable and happy to show-off the kitchen.√¢¬Ä¬ù Rob √¢¬Ä¬ú√¢¬Ä¬úComing from the UK and being local in Greytown, we were very excited about a new Indian Restaurant in our town. When we tried it and found it to be consistently the best curry in New Zealand, we were blown away. We can definitely recommend our favourite dishes which are Hariayala Murgh and Malabari Fish.√¢¬Ä¬ù Chris √¢¬Ä¬úWith the arrival of √¢¬Ä¬úAroma√¢¬Ä¬ù, Greytown can now boast as having the best Indian Restaurant in the Lower North Island. The ambience and style is warm and inviting, the staff always attentive friendly and happy. The menu is wide and varied but must-try dishes are the Garlic Chicken Tikka, the Hariayala Murgh, Lamb Masala and the Chicken Korma. After several visits, it√¢¬Ä¬ôs always a great feeling that the staff recognise you and always make you feel special. Dining-in or taking-out, nothing is an issue, and home delivery is always a massive bonus on cold winter nights!! √¢¬Ä¬ú Maureen √¢¬Ä¬úOne of the best Indian restaurants in the Wellington region. My husband and I go there several times a month for lunch or dinner as the menu is extensive, authentic, and the staff is exceedingly friendly and attentive. Dishes can be made to-order and Aroma has one of the best combination of spices, sauces, and fresh ingredients. An added bonus, we have taken our young Grandchildren there on occasion and they too are made to feel equally welcome. I highly recommend Aroma for anyone wanting a great Indian meal!√¢¬Ä¬ù Colin √¢¬Ä¬úBefore dining at aroma india I√¢¬Ä¬ôd had Indian food half-a-dozen times but found its a little dry and not to my taste. We moved to Greytown 2 years ago and my wife asked me to try Aroma India. I found the restaurant to be clean and inviting, and the owner and staff pleasant and eager to chat. I now love Indian food √¢¬Ä¬ì it√¢¬Ä¬ôs always fresh and very tasty. My favourite is their chicken khorma (medium) with their delicious garlic naan. We like to eat there once a week. The first time we went there we asked for ice in our wine √¢¬Ä¬ì strange but true! The second time they remembered us and asked if we would like ice! AMAZING! GREAT STAFF, GREAT FOOD.√¢¬Ä¬ù Chelle √¢¬Ä¬úAroma has added some delicious spice to our life! We love trying something new each visit and appreciate being able to specify the level of spice. The hariyala murgh is delicious.√¢¬Ä¬ù Previous Next LOCATION 74-76 Main Street, Greytown 5712, New Zealand 06 304 8080 069298209 aromaindia38@gmail.com Phone 06 304 8080, 069298209 Email aromaindia03@gmail.com Location 74-76 Main Street, Greytown 5712 ‚Üë

name: Chang Thai
homepage_content: Chang Thai Skip to content Chang Thai Experience the Authentic Taste of Thailand in Christchurch See MENU & Order Table Reservation Our Story Chang Thai is a Thai restaurant located in Christchurch, New Zealand. Established in February 2019, Chang Thai is the perfect place for anyone who likes to experience the flavors of authentic Thai cuisine. We have been passionate about crafting authentic Thai meals for generations. While the tastes of each dish stay loyal to traditional preparations, we aim to contribute something new to our customers every day. Our intense and bold flavors stand out among the other restaurants in the area, and the cozy, welcoming atmosphere of the restaurant invites guests to stay a while and enjoy a fantastic meal. From Thai street cuisine to classic meals, the Chang Thai creates each dish with the same love and attention passed down through generations. Our dedication to using only the freshest ingredients and traditional cooking techniques guarantees that each menu is both savory and genuine. Whether you‚Äôre searching for a quick bite to eat or a leisurely evening with friends, Chang Thai is the perfect spot to enjoy the flavor of Thailand right in the heart of Christchurch Authenticity, Deliciousness Guaranteed Unique Thai Recepes We provide authentic Thai Food that‚Äôs prepared from our secret recipes by our chef from Thailand. These unique Thai recipes set us apart from the rest in terms of flavor and authenticity, using family-favorite flavor combinations. Best Ingredients We combine the best original Thai ingredients that will delight your taste buds while feeding your body the nutrients it needs. Enjoy exquisite dishes in a superb ambiance made especially for you Food for All Moods Our menu offers a variety of dishes to suit every palate, from spicy and savory to mild and comforting. Many flavors and different food options suit everyone‚Äôs favorite taste. Whether you‚Äôre looking for a fiery Thai curry or a more subtle Pad Thai, we have something for everyone. Our Menu Food Discover a variety of our food ranging from starter Thai cuisine to curry and noodles View Menu Drinks Discover a variety of exquisite drinks both alcohol and non-alcohol that will help refresh your day View Menu Warm & Cozy The atmosphere of Chang Thai is warm and cozy, like a home away from home. The contemporary and family-style decor creates a calming and inviting ambiance, while the pleasant aromas of freshly cooked authentic Thai cuisine fill the air. The friendly staff ensures that guests feel at home, while the relaxed seating area allows guests to enjoy their meals comfortably. The warm and cozy atmosphere of Chang Thai is the perfect place to relax and unwind while enjoying the delicious traditional flavors of Thai cooking. At Chang Thai, we strive to make every visit a pleasant experience. Our friendly staff is always available to answer questions and help you make the best meal selections. We invite you to come and experience our unique Thai recipes today! Contact Us See MENU & Order Table Reservation 21 Shands Road, Hornby Christchurch 8042 033497069 Opening Hours Mon: Close Tue-Sun: 11.30 am-2.30 pm 5.00 pm-9.00 pm Call: 033497069

name: Decks Of Paihia
homepage_content: Paihia Bed and Breakfast Accommodation - Bay of Islands NZ Find out more Luxury Boutique Accommodation in Paihia, Bay of Islands Decks of Paihia offers purpose built boutique luxury bed and breakfast accommodation in our comfortable home. The property has undergone a stylish refurbishment in July 2020. Set on the hill in a secluded sunny north facing position, overlooking central Paihia and the immediate Bay. Daily breakfast is included in your rate and is served in our communal guest dining room with views overlooking the bay. Beautiful sun-drenched decks offer several vantage points to enjoy the vista. In ground swimming pool located outside the guest rooms offers a sunny, private and secluded area to relax and enjoy the solitude and beautiful bird life in the adjacent native bush. Decks of Paihia is also only a couple of minutes‚Äô drive from the centre of Paihia and the wharf and maritime area. An easy downhill stroll will have you in the village centre in 10 minutes. All guest rooms have ensuite bathrooms and are stylishly furnished for maximum comfort . Refurbished to a high standard in July 2020 . Email Us: info@decksofpaihia.com Tel: +64 9 402 6146 or +64 21 278 7558 or +64 21 030 4427 FREE WIFI DAILY BREAKFAST INCLUDED GUEST POOL CENTRAL LOCATION Meet Your Hosts Phil and Wendy Hopkinson have been living in the Bay of Islands for 27 years, moving north from Auckland in 1994. At this time we designed and built a backpackers lodge which we operated successfully until 2001. Our love of travelling and swapping stories with our guests enabled us to meet some wonderful people and has led us to develop and build our new home containing boutique guest accommodation. We opened Decks of Paihia in 2005 and we love to share our home and extensive knowledge of Northland and New Zealand with those who come to stay. We look forward to your visit. Both Phil and Wendy are fully vaccinated against Covid-19 and would respectfully request that our guests are also. ‚Äì Phil and Wendy Phil & Wendy are happy to offer complimentary transport to/from Paihia village if you are travelling without a car. Transfers to/from Kerikeri Airport are available with the local taxi shuttle services. We recommend Super Shuttles . Facebook Instagram LinkedIn Pinterest

name: Indo Tempeh House
homepage_content: Indo Tempeh House 0 Traditionally healthy. Tempeh (Javanese t√©mp√©) is a fermented soy product originating in Indonesia. Well-known as a real and super food due to its simple manufacturing process, the use-benefits of fermentation and using a very few ingredients. It is also popular among vegan and healthy-diet people as a meat substitute with rich-nutrients. Indo Tempeh House is a family-owned NZ business, originally from Indonesia, dedicated to producing authentic and delicious tempeh. Tempeh is one food that can be cooked in various ways, both traditional and modern, simple and complex.

Incredible experience best kebab I‚Äôve ever had will recommend for all my friends and family. I love how the lamb is proper cuts of meat and not mince. Highly recommend incredible service. Vicey The vegetarian moussaka was out of this world. Awesome comfort food and the portion size was huge. I almost didn‚Äôt have room for baklava, which was delicious, too. A casual space to go have a satisfying meal. My friend got chicken skewers and commented they were cooked to perfection. S Stumbled across this awesome little cafe in Auckland during my weekend stay. We ordered the lamb on chips and a meatlovers pizza. The food was very good quality and tasted delicious. The pizza's are woodfired and it was perfectly done. The lamb on chips/lamb snack pack was also very tasty and filling. Thank you very much! Darlo This place is great. I enjoyed it so much i went back again a few nights later! Would recommend all to try it. Andrew This place has become my goto Turkish eatery. In my opinion the best lamb in Auckland and the rice is cooked so perfectly fluffy. The eatery is open late and I like to bring my friends here. The team is also very friendly. Dan Absolutely beautiful meals. We had the Lamb Shish Kebab and Mixed Platter . The lamb was perfect and so delicious. Both meals flavorsome and extremely enjoyable. We both so enjoyed our meals and our time at the little Turkish caf√©. We will be making this a regular place to eat. Book a Berth Call Us A premier superyacht marina for refits and maintenance Port Nikau is a premier superyacht marina and a top destination for maintenance and refits in the South Pacific. Located in WhangƒÅrei's Port WhangƒÅrei, it offers world-class marine services and infrastructure, making it the only superyacht marina in New Zealand's northernmost city. Haveli contain partitions which divide the big hall into small but innovative parts. It is a kind of traditional hall which contains many attractive things like old musical instruments, different portraits and many more. Basically, Haveli means a brick house that is why the brick wall partitions have been used in dinning hall to give it a similar look. Order Online Ôñê Call Us For Online Order 04 260 10 88 Welcome to Spice Totara Authentic Indian Flavors, Right Here in New Zealand At Spice Totara, we bring the vibrant, rich tastes of India to the heart of New Zealand. Nestled in a cozy corner, we offer an unforgettable dining experience where traditional Indian recipes are infused with fresh, local ingredients. From aromatic spices to bold flavors, every dish is crafted with love and passion, bringing you a true taste of Indian heritage. Whether you‚Äôre enjoying a hearty curry, sizzling tandoori, or our delicate biryanis, you can be sure that every bite will transport you to the streets of India. Join us for a memorable meal where every visit is a celebration of good food, great company, and authentic Indian hospitality. Order Online Delicious Menu ‚Äì Spice Totara Our Menu Welcome to Spice Totara, where we offer a delightful array of dishes inspired by the rich flavors of Indian and South Asian cuisine. Whether you‚Äôre craving a spicy curry, a fragrant biryani, or a refreshing drink, our menu has something to satisfy every taste. From hearty meat dishes to vegetarian specialties, we use only the finest ingredients and traditional cooking methods to ensure every meal is a memorable experience. Explore our diverse menu and discover your new favorite dish! name: Spice Totara Indian Restaurant
homepage_content: Best Indian Restaurant in T≈çtara Park, Upper Hutt - Try Today Experience the Flavors of India at Spice Totara Discover the rich flavors of India at Spice Totara, where authentic spices, traditional recipes, and fresh ingredients combine to create an unforgettable dining experience in the heart of New Zealand. Order Online Ôñê Call Us For Online Order 04 260 10 88 Welcome to Spice Totara Authentic Indian Flavors, Right Here in New Zealand At Spice Totara, we bring the vibrant, rich tastes of India to the heart of New Zealand. Nestled in a cozy corner, we offer an unforgettable dining experience where traditional Indian recipes are infused with fresh, local ingredients. From aromatic spices to bold flavors, every dish is crafted with love and passion, bringing you a true taste of Indian heritage. Whether you‚Äôre enjoying a hearty curry, sizzling tandoori, or our delicate biryanis, you can be sure that every bite will transport you to the streets of India. Join us for a memorable meal where every visit is a celebration of good food, great company, and authentic Indian hospitality. Order Online Delicious Menu ‚Äì Spice Totara Our Menu Welcome to Spice Totara, where we offer a delightful array of dishes inspired by the rich flavors of Indian and South Asian cuisine. Whether you‚Äôre craving a spicy curry, a fragrant biryani, or a refreshing drink, our menu has something to satisfy every taste. From hearty meat dishes to vegetarian specialties, we use only the finest ingredients and traditional cooking methods to ensure every meal is a memorable experience. Explore our diverse menu and discover your new favorite dish! This charming eatery has quickly become a beloved spot for locals and visitors alike, known for its delightful menu and warm atmosphere. The Rope and Twine stands out with its focus on quality ingredients and generous portion sizes. Here, you can indulge in a variety of mouthwatering dishes designed to satisfy any craving. Whether you're in the mood for a hearty Chicken, Bacon, or Beef Bacon Burger for $30.00‚Äîcomplete with gherkin, lettuce, tomato, grilled cheese, and sriracha aioli‚Äîor the delectable Blue Cod , served beer-battered or pan-fried with salad and fries for $75.40, every bite promises a burst of flavor. One of the highlights of dining at The Rope and Twine is the attention given to details. Customers rave about the excellent service and the friendly staff , who make everyone feel like a welcome guest. The atmosphere is warm and inviting, making it the perfect spot for a casual lunch or a special occasion. Regular customer Erika Astried shared her appreciation for the cozy dining room and the enticing specials that keep her coming back for more. It‚Äôs moments like these that turn a simple meal into a memorable experience. Bucket List Dishes: Chicken Schnitzel: Tender chicken with fresh greens and rich mushroom gravy. Bowl of Wedges: Perfectly crispy potato wedges to complement any meal. As you explore the menu, you'll find options that cater to all tastes, whether you're a meat lover or seeking lighter fare. And don‚Äôt forget to try the Tuatara tap beer , highly recommended by regulars for its refreshing quality. The Rope and Twine isn‚Äôt just about great food; it‚Äôs about the community it fosters. Customers like Sinclair McLaren praise not only the food and drinks but the spirited atmosphere created by the cheerful staff. Whether celebrating a birthday lunch, enjoying a casual meal with friends, or simply kicking back after a long day, The Rope and Twine provides an experience that feels like home. If you‚Äôre seeking a place where good food meets excellent service in a cozy setting, look no further than The Rope and Twine. You‚Äôll leave with a full belly and a happy heart. name: Wayfarer
homepage_content: Wayfarer Cafe Skip to content An oasis at Auckland Airport. eighthirty coffee, craft beers, local wine, and fresh hand crafted food. Almost worth missing your flight! A collection of true hospitality experts covering skills of precise coffee extraction, customer service, food development & creation, management, and brand creation. The team have worked together for over 5 years and bring a shared passion to create greatness in forgotten spaces. From right to left: Leon Kenner ‚Äì Head chef Auckland Airports and former chef of the year for Mojo Coffee Cartel. Ben Blair ‚Äì Retail lead, brand creator, and advisor bringing 25 years hospitality experience. Rachael Riley ‚Äì Site Manager and former senior barista for Atomic coffee. Eddie Chae ‚Äì Coffee nerd & training specialist and former senior barista for Mojo Coffee Cartel. Loved the food will definitely be back for more!!! Privacy & Cookies: This site uses cookies. name: The Boat - Caf√É¬© & Bar
homepage_content: Boat Cafe 0 A dining experience like no other welcome aboard We've switched to using beef tallow for deep frying, and are working towards a seed oil-free kitchen. However, we understand that dietary preferences and requirements vary, so we still offer a non-animal fat fryer option for vegetarians and those with dietary needs, or simply for those who prefer a different taste! FOOD Drinks welcome to a special piece of New Zealand history... This classic steam tug was one of the last of her kind. Originally named the Aucklander , she was delivered from Scotland all the way to Auckland in 1958. She spent years towing and ship handling around the Auckland port until she was replaced by the technology of new engines. In 1986, a Wellington businessman by the name of Clem Griffiths purchased her to establish Wellington‚Äôs first and only floating restaurant. After renaming the vessel Tapuhi II , the ‚ÄúTugboat on the Bay‚Äù restaurant opened to the public at Oriental Bay in 1992. She‚Äôs undergone quite a few changes over the years, but to this day she continues to float proudly. Now under new management, we hope to provide you with friendly service, delicious food and the best views of the harbour! Come eat, drink and relax ‚Äì you‚Äôre always welcome on our boat. Looking for a venue? We have the perfect spot to host your next party or event. Email us theboatnz@gmail.com today to discuss your options! Caf√© at Westerman‚Äôs is a great place to enjoy a relaxing coffee or sweet treat. At Dairy Beanz, we specialize in roasting your beans to perfection. With exceptional attention to detail, the full, flavourful, aromatic coffee will speak for itself. Keep Exploring... Roast-to-Order Freshness, Free Shipping Nationwide. Get fresh roasted-to-order coffee delivered to your door anywhere in NZ, FREE shipping on most coffee orders over $25 nationwide. Fresher, higher-quality small-batch coffee for the same price you normally pay at the store. Brew better, make a difference. Enjoy coffee roasted fresh to order‚Äînot weeks in advance. You'll always know exactly when your Dairy Beanz coffee was hand-roasted, unlike stale supermarket options. Order Your Beanz Let customers speak for us from 33 reviews Excellently roasted to my perfection I have tried the Sumatran Mandheling Gr1 from a different roaster and find Dairybeanz coffee roasters provide a consistent excellent roast. I have a sensitive stomach and this low acid Sumatran Mandheling is so good that I can now drink 3-4. Flat whites a day. The communication from order to delivery is also excellent and appreciated. Thank you for providing this great coffee bean. Trevor Lowrey 11/04/2025 Indonesian Sumatran Mandheling Gr1 - Single Origin | Dark Roast Best coffee on the go I‚Äôm unashamed to say I‚Äôm a complete coffee snob and the thought of instant coffee makes me want to gag so when I found that I could get ‚Äòtakeaway‚Äô Dairy Beans coffee in the drip bags for camping, boating, day trips I was stoked! name: Endeavour Concepts
homepage_content: Leading ERP Solutions Partner | Endeavour NZ Empower Your Business with Tailored ERP Solutions Partners In Your Success Our mission is to deliver the best quality and reliability, ensuring positive outcomes for every client we serve. Explore Our Solutions Contact Us Scroll Why we are great to work with. We‚Äôre committed to enabling your success through the effective deployment of ERP software. Our mission is to deliver the best quality and reliability, ensuring positive outcomes for every client we serve. We are recognised as industry leaders, known for our well-resourced team of engaged ERP professionals who inspire our clients to achieve greater success. Our team of dedicated professionals focuses on understanding your unique needs and delivering practical solutions that drive sustainable growth. With a foundation built on honesty, collaboration, and commitment, we ensure transparent communication and consistent support throughout every project. Learn More Did you know? Endeavour helps you grow Stop Guessing, Start Growing: Download your guide to connecting and digitising the field to office. Download our eGuide to discover how Kynection and cloud ERP, expertly implemented by Endeavour, can provide your NZ horticulture or agriculture business with real-time insights, streamlined operations, boosted profitability and simplified compliance. Download now Products We partner with industry-leading vendors to provide comprehensive ERP solutions. MYOB Acumatica Cloud-based ERP designed to adapt to your growing business needs while offering flexibility and scalability. MYOB Acumatica Microsoft Dynamics 365 Business Central An all-in-one cloud-based ERP solution, Business Central streamlines operations and enhances customer engagement. Microsoft Dynamics 365 Business Central Wiise Wiise is a Microsoft Dynamics cloud-based ERP solution, that includes localised features to comply with ANZ banking, tax and compliance. Allowing businesses to streamline operations management. Wiise Qlik Qlik is a powerful business intelligence platform that transforms data into actionable insights, empowering users to explore data and discover trends. Qlik Kynection Kynection replaces disconnected tools and paper-based processes with a single integrated platform. Kynection Industries Endeavour specialises in delivering tailored ERP and business solutions across diverse industries, including: Manufacturing Manufacturing Wholesale & Distribution Wholesale & Distribution Transport & Logistics Transport & Logistics Horticulture & Agriculture Horticulture & Agriculture Construction Construction Contact us Let‚Äôs work together to achieve your business goals. Contact Us Success Stories We help companies across New Zealand implement and modernise core business systems. Axis Health faced significant challenges due to outdated systems amid growing demand for their healthcare products across multiple regions. Axis Health's leadership began seeking a robust, scalable solution to support centralising their multiple warehouse operation and comprehensive product range emphasising the need for improved accuracy, accessibility, and reporting capabilities. Read More TMC, a company with a history dating back to 1948, recognised the need to transition from their outdated, non-cloud systems that had limited integration and functionality. After evaluating several ERP software options, TMC determined that MYOB was the best fit for their needs, partnering with Endeavour to execute the implementation. Read More During a period of growth, DSS recognised that their current accounting software was no longer sufficient for their needs. The existing system had limited capabilities, particularly in terms of analysis, and it forced the team to rely on time-consuming workarounds. In their quest for a better solution, they began their due diligence and came across Endeavour‚Äôs website. The rest is history. Read More Bascik Transport was using an outdated financial system, leading to inefficiencies in managing accounting processes. The company needed a modern, cloud-based ERP to scale with its operations. After evaluating options, Bascik chose MYOB Advanced, with Endeavour as its implementation partner. The transition improved financial reporting, streamlined approvals, and enabled real-time data transfers, fostering data-driven decision-making. Read More Axiam Plastics faced inefficiencies from disconnected systems affecting financial reporting, production tracking, and order management. With over 100 employees, the company needed a scalable, cloud-based ERP for better data centralisation and reporting accuracy. Partnering with Endeavour, Axiam implemented MYOB Advanced, which provided a unified system that improved operations and supported future growth through flexible reporting and industry-specific features. Read More Golden Bay Fruit was using an outdated legacy ERP system with a cumbersome green screen interface that relied heavily on manual data entry, creating ongoing issues for the accounting department due to its time-sensitive and error-prone processes. Recognising these challenges, GBF reached out to Endeavour for support in modernising and updating their systems. Read More Axis Health TMC Trailers Direct Scaffolding Supplies Bascik Transport Axiam Plastics Golden Bay Fruit Axis Health TMC Trailers Direct Scaffolding Supplies Bascik Transport Axiam Plastics Golden Bay Fruit Read All Stories Resources We‚Äôve been in the ERP and business software industry for a long time. Check out our wealth of resources below. All Resources

name: Food For Thought Caterers
homepage_content: Free school nutrition education backed by Foodstuffs 555-555-5555 In-person and digital nutrition education Empowering healthier futures More Info Food for Thought - Empowering Healthier Futures NEW : We‚Äôve introduced an exciting digital learning component called ‚ÄòFood for Thought: Nutrition Quest‚Äô . This interactive online resource is designed to support classroom learning and can also be used independently, giving students another engaging way to explore healthy eating habits. Food for Thought is a FREE school-based nutrition education programme for Year 5 and 6 students. Students learn valuable skills to make informed food choices through inquiry-based learning. Sessions take place both inside and outside the classroom with a trip to your local New World, PAK‚ÄônSAVE or Four Square supermarket to put learnings into practice in a real-world setting. Food for Thought makes for a unique and fun nutrition education experience. Our qualified Nutritionists have been spreading knowledge across Aotearoa New Zealand since 2007, reaching more than 266,000 tamariki since the programme‚Äôs inception. 10,500+ CLASSES NGƒÄ AKOMANGA 280,000+ STUDENTS NGƒÄ ƒÄKONGA 17,000+ ADULT HELPERS NGƒÄ KAIƒÄWHINA Find Your Nutritionist Our Programme Food for Thought is governed by the Food for Thought Educational Trust, a New Zealand-registered charity. Ôªø Our Board of Trustees Ôªø The programme is proudly supported by Foodstuffs in both the North and South Islands and is delivered in partnership with the Heart Foundation. PAK'nSAVE, New World and Four Square supermarkets all back the programme to help educate our tamariki. For over a decade, the Heart Foundation has been proud to deliver the Food for Thought programme to schools across Aotearoa New Zealand. Learning about food is important for our health, and starting early ensures students have the best opportunity to build on and practise this knowledge throughout their lifetime. quotesArtboard 1 "The presenter was great and had an excellent relationship with the children, they were fully engaged and interested in the content" ~ Classroom Teacher Button "This is such a cool initiative and I love that it ties it into our local community supermarket so the kids can see how they can actually use the information they learned in the real world!" ~ Classroom Teacher, Discovery School Button ‚ÄúI really really really really really really hope that you can come back again. I love learning about food because it‚Äôs food, who doesn't like food, you need food to survive‚Äù ~ Dustyn, Lower Moutere School Button Share by:

Learning about food is important for our health, and starting early ensures students have the best opportunity to build on and practise this knowledge throughout their lifetime. quotesArtboard 1 "The presenter was great and had an excellent relationship with the children, they were fully engaged and interested in the content" ~ Classroom Teacher Button "This is such a cool initiative and I love that it ties it into our local community supermarket so the kids can see how they can actually use the information they learned in the real world!" ~ Classroom Teacher, Discovery School Button ‚ÄúI really really really really really really hope that you can come back again. I love learning about food because it‚Äôs food, who doesn't like food, you need food to survive‚Äù ~ Dustyn, Lower Moutere School Button Share by:

name: Founders Heritage Park
homepage_content: Kia Ora & Greetings Menu Home Our Attractions Must See Highlights Explore Our Displays Our Artisans What's On In Founders Venues For Hire The Granary The Jaycee Room The Energy Centre Old St Peter's Church Full Park Wedding Hire Conference and Events Our Collection Re-Org Project Collections Online Planning your Visit Getting Here & Getting In Other Nelson Heritage Experiences Useful Heritage Links Contact Us Welcome, adventure seekers and history enthusiasts! Brace yourselves for an epic family escapade at our heritage park ‚Äì where the past meets playground! Picture this: a whimsical afternoon strolling through a village straight out of storybooks, surrounded by quirky character buildings and gardens that have clearly earned their green thumbs-up. It's not just a walk; it's a journey through time, with displays that spill the beans on Nelson's rich heritage, tales of local legends, and a chance to high-five our resident artisans who turn history into masterpieces. Pack your curiosity, bring the fam, and get ready to explore, learn, and maybe even time-travel a little. Adventure awaits at our heritage park ‚Äì where the past has never been this fun! Founders Heritage Park Virtual Tour Founders Annual Book Fair Ride The Train What's happening Opening Hours Exciting arts and crafts made on-site are available at our reception area. The Windmill Founders Store, open 7 days 10am-4.30pm. Venues to Hire A variety of venues cater for every event.
